concept.title: Key Considerations and Safety Precautions During Drawband and Mainspring Repairs
concept.shortdesc: When performing removal, reattachment, or replacement of the drawband and mainspring, it is important to take certain safety precautions and consider the tension stored in the mainspring.

ul.li: Any repair or replacement involving the drawband or mainspring requires removal of the drawband from the spring barrel before beginning work.
Once the degreaser reaches the mainspring and loosens it, the barrel may jump or pop as the internal tension of the spring is released.
Typewriter mainsprings are wound under high tension. Wearing gloves and eye protection is essential to prevent injury from sharp spring edges that can rapidly unwind or pop out during removal.
